image.altText: Tony Burke speaks at a press conference at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: An independent administrator will be appointed to overhaul the CFMEU following allegations the embattled union had been infiltrated by underworld figures.

title.children: CFMEU to be overhauled by independent administrator

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The suspect in the killings of Australian couple David James Fisk and Lucita Barquin Cortez and their Filipina companion at at a luxury resort in the Philippines has surrendered.

title.children: Police say suspect in killing of Australian couple in Philippines 'wanted to get back at the hotel for his dismissal'

props.synopsis: A radical sovereign citizen group co-invented by a fugitive mother is using a fake court to justify attempted child abduction, extortion, and intimidation of court officials.

title.children: The fake court harassing families and judges with 'utter weightless legal gobbledygook'

image.altText: A 3D model of the Trump rally shooting.

props.synopsis: To get a better understanding of the position of the shooter in relation to the US Secret Service snipers, the ABC has recreated the scene of the fatal rally in Pennsylvania.

title.children: Here's what 3D modelling reveals about what snipers could and couldn’t see moments before shots rang out

image.altText: Gabriel Attal walks through a door, as an attendant walks in.

props.synopsis: The former French prime minister has been appointed to a 'caretaker government', responsible for running the Paris Olympic Games next week.

title.children: Gabriel Attal has resigned as France's prime minister, but not from politics

image.altText: A woman holds a piece of paper and stares blankly while sitting at a dining table.

props.synopsis: After being rescued by emergency helicopter in Tasmania, Kayla Dempsey was shocked to receive the massive bill more than a year later.

title.children: 14 months after rolling her ankle, Kayla was billed $45,000

image.altText: Jill and Roger Guard smile, wearing formalwear as they pose for a photo in a sunlit garden setting.

props.synopsis: For thousands of Australians, the world changed forever on July 17, 2014. A decade later, those who knew and loved the 38 Australians who lost their lives on MH17 are determined to ensure they will never be forgotten.

title.children: A decade after the MH17 tragedy devastated Australian families, tributes burn bright

image.altText: A whale's tail. One side is jagged.

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old and a 69-year-old have been hospitalised after police and emergency services were called to an incident off the coast of Kalbarri involving a boat believed to have been struck by a whale.

title.children: Two men injured after boat believed to have been struck by whale off WA coast, police say

image.altText: JD Vance stands with arms folded across his chest, chin raised

props.synopsis: When Donald Trump first took office, JD Vance boldly declared he would never support him. So how did this conservative venture capitalist-turned-politician win over the former president to become his pick for Republican vice-president?

title.children: Once a self-declared 'Never Trumper', JD Vance is now aligned on everything from abortion to the war in Ukraine

image.altText: Sally McManus standing in front of an ACTU banner.

props.synopsis: ACTU secretary Sally McManus denies prior knowledge of alleged criminality within the CFMEU as politicians come under fire over letters sent in 2022.

title.children: Sally McManus issues multiple denials over whether she knew of alleged criminality in CFMEU

image.altText: Josh Perry looks towards the camera with a surprised look on his face

props.synopsis: He may be a simple protein-and-three-veg man from the country, but Tasmanian butcher Josh "Pezza" Perry has done his hometown of Smithton proud by coming second in the grand final of MasterChef Australia.

title.children: Dessert dashes small town's hopes Tassie butcher could win MasterChef

image.altText: An elderly Asian woman standing next to a larger, middle-aged Caucasian male.

props.synopsis: Lily and her real estate agent are among a growing number of Australians who have been targeted by cyber criminals.

title.children: 'Every minute for me is suffering': Scammers target Australian property sales

image.altText: Trump, with a bandaged ear, speaks to JD Vance

props.synopsis: Former rivals of Donald Trump, including Nikki Haley and Ron DeSantis, have come full circle to endorse him for the presidency at the Republican National Convention. Follow live.

title.children: Former Trump rivals come full circle to endorse him at Republican convention

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Nikki Haley's come full circle to endorse Trump
Donald Trump has returned to the convention
'He was very kind': Trump calls widow of rally shooting victim

image.altText: POlice officers on a roof look through the sights of their rifles.

props.synopsis: US officials say a threat from Iran prompted the the Secret Service to boost protection around Donald Trump before Saturday's attempted assassination.

title.children: US officials say Secret Service received intelligence about Iranian plot to assassinate Trump

image.altText: Jack Black and Kyle Gass of Tenacious D play guitars. Black holds up the devil horns sign with his fingers.

props.synopsis: Australian ambassador to the US slams Jack Black's band after an onstage quip about the weekend's assassination attempt, saying jokes about physical violence make him feel "physically ill".

title.children: 'Devastated' fans mourn Tenacious D's cancelled tour after Trump assassination joke

image.altText: SES staffer in snowy conditions.

props.synopsis: A family of three stranded in a Tasmanian national park for 36 hours has been airlifted to safety, with police describing it as a "close call which could have ended tragically".

title.children: Adults, boy found by rescuers in hypothermic state after weather traps them in Tasmanian wilderness

image.altText: Man walking into court holding documents and covering his face with an umbrella.

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court Tasmanian Supreme Court justice Gregory Geason was "venomous" and verbally abusive towards her. She has detailed an alleged assault he perpetrated against her, which left her with a head injury.

title.children: 'I just remember flying backwards': Woman tells court of alleged assault by Supreme Court judge

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks higher following US retail sales data supporting the view the Federal Reserve is approaching its easing cycle, reining in inflation while avoiding a recession. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX rises after Dow notches record closing high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Star Entertainment up after gaming machines switched back on
How sustainable is the ASX's record high of 8,000?
ASX up 0.9pc at lunch as tech stocks soar

image.altText: Rebecca in a yellow dress hugging her two sons in her kitchen.

props.synopsis: Families dealing with food allergies say the price of their weekly shop has more than doubled, with calls for subsidised groceries to help relieve the pressure on people suffering from coeliac disease.

title.children: This registered nurse is working two jobs so she can afford the rising cost of gluten-free products

image.altText: Jeanine Kimm in the shearing shed

props.synopsis: There are just 2,000 sheep shearers left keeping a $3.5 billion export industry alive. Rather than sit on idle hands, hardened workers are trying to entice the next generation into the shed.

title.children: 'Shear hard … have a house paid off in ten years': Bid to entice the next generation of sheep shearers

image.altText: A piece of plane wreckage bearing the Malaysia Airlines livery in a field.

props.synopsis: A decade ago, a Malaysia Airlines plane was shot out of the sky and crashed in eastern Ukraine, killing everyone on board. Here's a brief summary of the MH17 disaster.

title.children: Flight MH17 was shot down in 2014. Here's what happened to the Malaysia Airlines plane

image.altText: A blue Telstra T letter and oval next to a hanging shop sign with the word 'Telstra' on it

props.synopsis: The communications watchdog found Telstra failed to authenticate customer IDs during 168,000 high-risk interactions such as password resets or SIM card swaps.

title.children: Telstra fined $1.5m for leaving customers vulnerable to scams

image.altText: Serbia's Aleksa Avramovic, drives to the basket as Australia's Patty Mills tries to block him

props.synopsis: On the eve of the Olympics Patty Mills has found form and inspired the Boomers to an impressive pre-Games victory over Serbia.

title.children: Mills fires for Boomers during victory over Serbia in Olympic warm-up

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: A pathway forward on how to respond to allegations the high-profile union was infiltrated by underworld figures could become clearer when the Labor Party's national executive meets.

title.children: Claims of bikie links and intimidation: Who has oversight of the CFMEU?

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair is shouting into a megaphone at a pro-Palestinian student rally

props.synopsis: Young people's view of politics and political expression differs from older generations, and they're showing it by abandoning the two major parties.

title.children: Young diverse voters split with Labor over war in Gaza

image.altText: Pam, partner and furniture

props.synopsis: Amid the increasing demand on outreach services, some communities are banding together to try and bridge the gap for those struggling to make ends meet.

title.children: As the cost-of-living crisis takes its toll on Australians, some are looking outside the box for solutions

image.altText: A cane toad on a rock lit by a flash, in the background a pink sky and a boab tree silhouette

props.synopsis: A bevy of small mammals and lizards could find themselves on the endangered species list if cane toads got into the Pilbara. A bold plan could prevent the biodiversity disaster, but more money is needed to fund the project before toads reach the coast in 2026–27.

title.children: Cane toads have almost conquered the width of the country. This 'waterless barrier' could stop them

image.altText: Chris Minns addresses the media in high vis jacket and helmet

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns has asked the state Labor Party's general secretary to suspend the CFMEU's construction and general division's affiliation and cease donations or affiliation fees from the union.

title.children: NSW government to cut ties with CFMEU following corruption allegations

image.altText: Close shot of a small dead whale on beach sand, mouth open and body intact, shining in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: Authorities say the discovery of three dead or injured whales along WA's Midwest coast is a sign of a healthy humpback population living and migrating off the state's coast.

title.children: Spate of whale deaths a sign of 'massive' population growth, authorities say

image.altText: A composite image of the woman and man in seperate images.

props.synopsis: Often referred to as the "second oldest profession", espionage is a tool used by many countries to keep tabs on their adversaries. So what were spies for Russia doing in Australia and how were they able to keep operating in secret?

title.children: I am a former FBI special agent. This is how Russian intelligence operates and why Australia was a target

image.altText: Eminem wears a black hoodie and short beard as he looks at camera.

props.synopsis: Eminem's new album is frustrating, but there are four new Australian albums that more than make up for it.

title.children: Eminem tries to get his alter ego Slim Shady cancelled on his new album, and it's not for everyone
